Header: President says the Government has launched a massive transformation in the education sector
Content: President Maithripala Sirisena has said that the Government has launched a massive transformation in the education sector in order to mould an educated generation. The President further stated that solutions can be found to many economic, social and political issues with an increase of academics. President Maithripala Sirisena made these observations participating in the Annual Prize Giving of Swarnapali Balika Vidyalaya in Anuradhapura. On arrival at the school, the President was accorded a very warm welcome by the students. The President who joined in the prize giving presented prizes and certificates to several children who exhibited their talents. A special gift was presented to the President. Addressing the students, the President said that excellence and discipline in man are mainly achieved due to education. In this respect, the President emphasized that the Government is dedicated to imparting the highest facilities. Meanwhile, the vesting of the new three storied classroom building of the Deepani Maha Vidyalaya in Anuradhapura took place under the patronage of the President. The President also exchanged pleasantries with the children. The expenditure incurred on the development carried out at the school under the nearby school is the best project, was 28.5 million rupees. President Maithripala Sirisena also declared open today the two storied Dana Salawa and the two storied students centre built at the Anuradhapura Sri Lanka Bikkhu University. These development activities took place spending 213 million rupees under the basic plan of developing it as a fully-fledged International Buddhist University. The function was chaired by the Mahanayake of the Sri Lanka Amarapura Maha Nikaya the Most Ven. Kotugoda Dhammawasa Thera. Present on the occasion were members of the Maha sangha including the current Mahopadyaya of the Sri Lanka Bikkhu University the Ven. Prof. Kanattegoda Saddharathana Thera. A book authored by the Ven. Pathegama Gnanissara Thera was handed over to the President. A group including Parliamentarians was present on the occasion.
